paragraphs: The wedding party will be based at the venue for the weekend and there are glamping and camping options for those who’d like to stay too. The venue is 20 minutes away from Salisbury but it is a bit out in the sticks so any taxis would need to be pre-booked.

New Forest Bell Tents will be setting up a bell tent village with all the essentials for the weekend and we'll be adding some homely comforts. The bell tents are a flat price for the whole weekend and can sleep between 2 and 7 people depending on which size you go for. You can book with them directly by clicking the button below.

camping.title: Onsite camping
camping.subtitle: For those who’d like to join us onsite

paragraphs: If you are a happy camper yourself already and would just like to bring your own tent set up (or campervan!) then you can book a pitch through Susie at Kingsettle Stud. It’s £15 for a pitch for the weekend.
We will also have a 5-metre communal bell tent set up for everyone camping to use as a social space.
There will be a luxury toilet block and use of showers. Caravans or motorhomes are welcome but there are no electric hookups.

For those preferring to stay off-site there are lots of options a bit further afield depending on your taste and budget. Salisbury probably has the most options and is a 20-minute drive away. You can also look at Airbnbs or hotels in surrounding villages. If you’re planning to take advantage of the open bar we would recommend pre-booking a taxi in advance. If you’re interested in sharing a taxi so you can split the cost (and carbon footprint!) then let us know and we will add you to all to a group so you can co-ordinate with other guests.
